meanings.definition: To place or fit between two things
meanings.sent1: She sandwiched the book between two heavy boxes.
meanings.sent2: The cheese is sandwiched between two slices of bread in a sandwich.
meanings.sent3: The cat got sandwiched between the couch cushions and couldn't get out!
meanings.sent4: His car was sandwiched between two huge trucks in the traffic jam.
meanings.sent5: The tiny flower was sandwiched between the tall blades of grass, barely visible.

meanings.definition: To be caught or pressed between two objects or surfaces
meanings.sent1: The keys got sandwiched between the sofa cushions.
meanings.sent2: The mouse was sandwiched between the wall and the fridge.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally sandwiched my hand in the door - ouch!
meanings.sent4: The poor bug was sandwiched between the pages of the heavy book.
meanings.sent5: The fallen leaf was sandwiched between the sidewalk cracks, unable to move.
